messages.content: NX_HuggingFace_Flux is a custom node for ComfyUI that allows generating images with the Flux-Dev or Flux-Schnell models directly on Hugging Face.
On which operating systems has NX_HuggingFace_Flux been tested?
NX_HuggingFace_Flux has been tested only on Linux. It should work without any problems on Windows and Mac but has not been tested on these operating systems.
How can you install NX_HuggingFace_Flux using GIT?

To install NX_HuggingFace_Flux using GIT, go to the 'custom_nodes' subfolder of your ComfyUI installation, open a terminal and type: 'git clone https://github.com/Franck-Demongin/NX_HuggingFace_Flux.git'.
What should you do if GIT is not installed on your system?

If GIT is not installed, retrieve the ZIP file from 'https://github.com/Franck-Demongin/NX_HuggingFace_Flux/archive/refs/heads/main.zip', unzip it into the 'custom nodes' folder and rename it NX_HuggingFace_Flux.
What are the features of NX_HuggingFace_Flux?
The features of NX_HuggingFace_Flux include the choice of template (Flux-Dev or Flux-Schnell), and settings for seed, image size, CFG and number of steps.
What are the recommended settings for the Flux-Dev model in NX_HuggingFace_Flux?
For the Flux-Dev model, it is recommended to use a high number of steps (25 to 50) and a CFG between 2.5 and 8.
What are the limitations of NX_HuggingFace_Flux?

The limitations of NX_HuggingFace_Flux include the availability of a GPU on Hugging Face to render the image and the GPU time quota allocated to each user. Due to these limitations, an error often occurs, stopping rendering.
